member.name: T:AutoCount.Data.IRegistryID
T:AutoCount.Data.DBRegistry
member.summary:
DBRegistry encapsulates the basic function to access a database Registry table.
Remember to use CreateDBRegistry to create the appropriate DBRegistry object for your database.
Use IncOne method to return the next Auto-Increment Key
Use GetValue method to return any value for a ID. You can pass a IRegistryID interface to GetValue.
Use SetValue method to set any value to a ID. You can pass a IRegistryID interface to SetValue.

member.name: T:WindowsInstaller.MsiAdvertiseProductFlag
member.summary: Internal class containing constants for the script parameter of or . This class cannot be inherited. This class cannot be instantiated directly.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiAdvertiseProductFlag.MachineAssign
member.summary: Set to advertise a per-machine installation of the product available to all users.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiAdvertiseProductFlag.UserAssign
member.summary: Set to advertise a per-user installation of the product available to a particular user.

member.name: T:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable
member.summary: Internal class containing constants for an MSI database. This class cannot be inherited. This class cannot be instantiated directly.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable._Columns
member.summary: The _Columns table is a read-only system table that contains the column catalog. It lists the columns for all the tables. You can query this table to find out if a given column exists.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable._Storages
member.summary: The _Storages table lists embedded OLE data storages. This is a temporary table, created only when referenced by a SQL statement.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable._Streams
member.summary: The _Streams table lists embedded OLE data streams. This is a temporary table, created only when referenced by a SQL statement.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable._Tables
member.summary: The _Tables table is a read-only system table that lists all the tables in the database. Query this table to find out if a table exists.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable._TransformView
member.summary: This is a read-only temporary table used to view transforms with the transform view mode. This table is never persisted by the installer.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable._Validation
member.summary: The _Validation table is a system table that contains the column names and the column values for all of the tables in the database. It is used during the database validation process to ensure that all columns are accounted for and have the correct values. This table is not shipped with the installer database.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ActionText
member.summary: The ActionText table contains text to be displayed in a progress dialog box and written to the log for actions that take a long time to execute. The text displayed consists of the action description and optionally formatted data from the action.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.AdminExecuteSequence
member.summary: The AdminExecuteSequence table lists actions that the installer calls in sequence when the top-level ADMIN action is executed.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.AdminUISequence
member.summary: The AdminUISequence table lists actions that the installer calls in sequence when the top-level ADMIN action is executed and the internal user interface level is set to full UI or reduced UI. The installer skips the actions in this table if the user interface level is set to basic UI or no UI.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.AdvtExecuteSequence
member.summary: The AdvtExecuteSequence table lists actions the installer calls when the top-level ADVERTISE action is executed.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.AdvtUISequence
member.summary: The installer does not use this table. The AdvtUISequence table should not exist in the installation database or it should be left empty.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.AppId
member.summary: The AppId table or the table specifies that the installer configure and register DCOM servers to do one of the following during an installation.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.AppSearch
member.summary: The AppSearch table contains properties needed to search for a file having a particular file signature. The AppSearch table can also be used to set a property to the existing value of a registry or .ini file entry.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.BBControl
member.summary: The BBControl table lists the controls to be displayed on each billboard.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Billboard
member.summary: The Billboard table lists the Billboard controls displayed in the full user interface.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Binary
member.summary: The Binary table holds the binary data for items such as bitmaps, animations, and icons. The binary table is also used to store data for custom actions.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.BindImage
member.summary: The BindImage table contains information about each executable or DLL that needs to be bound to the DLLs imported by it.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.CCPSearch
member.summary: The CCPSearch table contains the list of file signatures used for the Compliance Checking Program (CCP). At least one of these files needs to be present on a user's computer for the user to be in compliance with the program.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.CheckBox
member.summary: The CheckBox table lists the values for the check boxes.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Class
member.summary: The Class table contains COM server-related information that must be generated as a part of the product advertisement. Each row may generate a set of registry keys and values. The associated ProgId information is included in this table.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ComboBox
member.summary: The lines of a combo box are not treated as individual controls; they are part of a single combo box that functions as a control. This table lists the values for each combo box.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.CompLocator
member.summary: The CompLocator table holds the information needed to find a file or a directory using the installer configuration data.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Complus
member.summary: The Complus table contains information needed to install COM+ applications.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Component
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Condition
member.summary: The Condition table can be used to modify the selection state of any entry in the table based on a conditional expression.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Control
member.summary: The Control table defines the controls that appear on each dialog box.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ControlCondition
member.summary: The ControlCondition table enables an author to specify special actions to be applied to controls based on the result of a conditional statement. For example, using this table the author could choose to hide a control based on the VersionNT property.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ControlEvent
member.summary: The ControlEvent table allows the author to specify the Control Events started when a user interacts with a PushButton Control, CheckBox Control, or SelectionTree Control. These are the only controls users can use to initiate control events. Each control can publish multiple control events.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.CreateFolder
member.summary: The CreateFolder table contains references to folders that need to be created explicitly for a particular component.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.CustomAction
member.summary: The CustomAction table provides the means of integrating custom code and data into the installation. The source of the code that is executed can be a stream contained within the database, a recently installed file, or an existing executable file.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Dialog
member.summary: The Dialog table contains all the dialogs that appear in the user interface in both the full and reduced modes.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Directory
member.summary: The Directory table specifies the directory layout for the product. Each row of the table indicates a directory both at the source and the target.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.DrLocator
member.summary: The DrLocator table holds the information needed to find a file or directory by searching the directory tree.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.DuplicateFile
member.summary: The DuplicateFile table contains a list of files that are to be duplicated, either to a different directory than the original file or to the same directory but with a different name. The original file must be a file installed by the InstallFiles action.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Environment
member.summary: The Environment table is used to set the values of environment variables.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Error
member.summary: The Error table is used to look up error message formatting templates when processing errors with an error code set but without a formatting template set (this is the normal situation).
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.EventMapping
member.summary: The EventMapping table lists the controls that subscribe to some control event and lists the attribute to be changed when the event is published by another control or the installer.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Extension
member.summary: The Extension table contains information about file name extension servers that must be generated as a part of product advertisement. Each row generates a set of registry keys and values.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Feature
member.summary: The Feature table defines the logical tree structure of features.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.FeatureComponents
member.summary: The FeatureComponents table defines the relationship between features and components. For each feature, this table lists all the components that make up that feature.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.File
member.summary: The File table contains a complete list of source files with their various attributes, ordered by a unique, non-localized, identifier. Files can be stored on the source media as individual files or compressed within a cabinet file.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.FileSFPCatalog
member.summary: The FileSFPCatalog table associates specified files with the catalog files used by Windows Millennium Edition for Windows File Protection.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Font
member.summary: The Font table contains the information for registering font files with the system.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Icon
member.summary: This table contains the icon files. Each icon from the table is copied to a file as a part of product advertisement to be used for advertised shortcuts and OLE servers.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.IniFile
member.summary: The IniFile table contains the .ini information that the application needs to set in an .ini file.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.IniLocator
member.summary: The IniLocator table holds the information needed to search for a file or directory using an .ini file or to search for a particular .ini entry itself. The .ini file must be present in the default Microsoft Windows directory.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.InstallExecuteSequence
member.summary: The InstallExecuteSequence table lists actions that are executed when the top-level INSTALL action is executed.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.InstallUISequence
member.summary: The InstallUISequence table lists actions that are executed when the top-level INSTALL action is executed and the internal user interface level is set to full UI or reduced UI. The installer skips the actions in this table if the user interface level is set to basic UI or no UI.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.IsolatedComponent
member.summary: Each record of the IsolatedComponent table associates the component specified in the Component_Application column (commonly an .exe) with the component specified in the Component_Shared column (commonly a shared DLL). The IsolateComponents action installs a copy of Component_Shared into a private location for use by Component_Application. This isolates the Component_Application from other copies of Component_Shared that may be installed to a shared location on the computer.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.LaunchCondition
member.summary: The LaunchCondition table is used by the LaunchConditions action. It contains a list of conditions that all must be satisfied for the installation to begin.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ListBox
member.summary: The lines of a list box are not treated as individual controls, but they are part of a list box that functions as a control. The ListBox table defines the values for all list boxes.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ListView
member.summary: The lines of a listview are not treated as individual controls, but they are part of a listview that functions as a control. The ListView table defines the values for all listviews.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.LockPermissions
member.summary: The LockPermissions table is used to secure individual portions of your application in a locked-down environment. It can be used with the installation of files, registry keys, and created folders.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Media
member.summary: The Media table describes the set of disks that make up the source media for the installation.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.MIME
member.summary: The MIME table associates a MIME content type with a file extension or a CLSID to generate the extension or COM server information required for advertisement of the MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) content.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModuleAdminUISequence
member.summary: For merge modules, a merge tool evaluates the ModuleAdminUISequence table and then inserts the calculated actions into the table with a correct sequence number.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModuleAdminExecuteSequence
member.summary: For merge modules, a merge tool evaluates the ModuleAdminExecuteSequence table and then inserts the calculated actions into the table with a correct sequence number.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModuleAdvtExecuteSequence
member.summary: For merge modules, a merge tool evaluates the ModuleAdvtExecuteSequence table and then inserts the calculated actions into the table with a correct sequence number.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModuleComponents
member.summary: For merge modules, the ModuleComponents table contains a list of the components found in the merge module.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModuleConfiguration
member.summary: For merge modules, the ModuleConfiguration table identifies the configurable attributes of the module. This table is not merged into the database.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModuleDependency
member.summary: For merge modules, the ModuleDependency table keeps a list of other merge modules that are required for this merge module to operate properly. This table enables a merge or verification tool to ensure that the necessary merge modules are in fact included in the user's installer database. The tool checks by cross referencing this table with the table in the installer database.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModuleExclusion
member.summary: For merge modules, the ModuleExclusion table keeps a list of other merge modules that are incompatible in the same installer database. This table enables a merge or verification tool to check that conflicting merge modules are not merged in the user's installer database. The tool checks by cross-referencing this table with the table in the installer database.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModeleIgnore
member.summary: For merge modules, if a table in the merge module is listed in the ModuleIgnoreTable table, it is not merged into the .msi file. If the table already exists in the .msi file, it is not modified by the merge. The tables in the ModuleIgnoreTable can therefore contain data that is unneeded after the merge.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModuleInstallExecuteSequence
member.summary: For merge modules, a merge tool evaluates the ModuleInstallExecuteSequence table and then inserts the calculated actions into the table with a correct sequence number.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModuleInstallUISequence
member.summary: For merge modules, a merge tool evaluates the ModuleInstallUISequence table and then inserts the calculated actions into the table with a correct sequence number.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModuleSignature
member.summary: For merge modules, the ModuleSignature Table is a required table. It contains all the information necessary to identify a merge module. The merge tool adds this table to the .msi file if one does not already exist. The ModuleSignature table in a merge module has only one row containing the ModuleID, Language, and Version. However, the ModuleSignature table in an .msi file has a row containing this information for each .msm file that has been merged into it.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ModuleSubstitution
member.summary: For merge modules, the ModuleSubstitution table specifies the configurable fields of a module database and provides a template for the configuration of each field. The user or merge tool may query this table to determine what configuration operations are to take place. This table is not merged into the target database.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.MoveFile
member.summary: This table contains a list of files to be moved or copied from a specified source directory to a specified destination directory.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.MsiAssembly
member.summary: The MsiAssembly table specifies Windows Installer settings for Microsoft .NET Framework assemblies and Win32 assemblies.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.MsiAssemblyName
member.summary: The MsiAssembly table and MsiAssemblyName table specify Windows Installer settings for common language runtime assemblies and Win32 assemblies.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.MsiDigitalCertificate
member.summary: The MsiDigitalCertificate table stores certificates in binary stream format and associates each certificate with a primary key. The primary key is used to share certificates among multiple digitally signed objects. A digital certificate is a credential that provides a means to verify identity.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.MsiDigitalSignature
member.summary: The MsiDigitalSignature table contains the signature information for every digitally signed object in the installation database.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.MsiFileHash
member.summary: The MsiFileHash table is used to store a 128-bit hash of a source file provided by the Windows Installer package. The hash is split into four 32-bit values and stored in separate columns of the table.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.MsiPatchHeaders
member.summary: The MsiPatchHeaders table holds the binary patch header streams used for patch validation. A patch containing a populated MsiPatchHeaders table can only be applied using Windows Installer version 2.0 or later.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ODBCAttribute
member.summary: The ODBCAttribute table contains information about the attributes of ODBC drivers and translators.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ODBCDataSource
member.summary: The ODBCDataSource table lists the data sources belonging to the installation.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ODBCDriver
member.summary: The ODBCDriver table lists the ODBC drivers belonging to the installation.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ODBCSourceAttribute
member.summary: The ODBCSourceAttribute table contains information about the attributes of data sources.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ODBCTranslator
member.summary: The ODBCTranslator table lists the ODBC translators belonging to the installation.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Patch
member.summary: The Patch table specifies the file that is to receive a particular patch and the physical location of the patch files on the media images.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.PatchPackage
member.summary: The PatchPackage table describes all patch packages that have been applied to this product. For each patch package, the unique identifier for the patch is provided along with information about the media image the on which the patch is located.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ProgId
member.summary: The ProgId table contains information for program IDs and version independent program IDs that must be generated as a part of the product advertisement.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Property
member.summary: The Property table contains the property names and values for all defined properties in the installation. Properties with Null values are not present in the table.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.PublishComponent
member.summary: The PublishComponent table associates components listed in the table with a qualifier text-string and a category ID GUID. Components with parallel functionality that have been grouped together in this way are referred to as qualified components.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.RadioButton
member.summary: Radio buttons are not treated as individual controls, but they are part of a radio button group that functions as a RadioButtonGroup control. The RadioButton table lists the buttons for all the groups.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Registry
member.summary: The Registry table holds the registry information that the application needs to set in the system registry.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.RegLocator
member.summary: The RegLocator table holds the information needed to search for a file or directory using the registry, or to search for a particular registry entry itself.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.RemoveFile
member.summary: The RemoveFile table contains a list of files to be removed by the RemoveFiles action. Setting the FileName column of this table to Null supports the removal of empty folders.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.RemoveIniFile
member.summary: The RemoveIniFile table contains the information an application needs to delete from a .ini file.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.RemoveRegistry
member.summary: The RemoveRegistry table contains the registry information the application needs to delete from the system registry.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ReserveCost
member.summary: The ReserveCost table is an optional table that allows the author to reserve an amount of disk space in any directory that depends on the installation state of a component.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.SelfReg
member.summary: The SelfReg table contains information about modules that need to be self registered. The installer calls the DllRegisterServer function during installation of the module; it calls DllUnregisterServer during uninstallation of the module. The installer does not self register EXE files.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ServiceControl
member.summary: The ServiceControl table is used to control installed or uninstalled services.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.ServiceInstall
member.summary: The ServiceInstall table is used to install a service.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.SFPCatalog
member.summary: The SFPCatalog table contains the catalogs used by Windows Millennium Edition for Windows File Protection on Windows Millennium Edition.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Shortcut
member.summary: The Shortcut table holds the information the application needs to create shortcuts on the user's computer.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Signature
member.summary: The Signature table holds the information that uniquely identifies a file signature.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.TextStyle
member.summary: The TextStyle table lists different font styles used in controls having text.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.TypeLib
member.summary: The TypeLib table contains the information that needs to be placed in the registry registration of type libraries.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.UIText
member.summary: The UIText table contains the localized versions of some of the strings used in the user interface. These strings are not part of any other table. The UIText table is for strings that have no logical place in any other table.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Upgrade
member.summary: The Upgrade table contains information required during major upgrades. To fully enable the installer's upgrade capabilities, every package should have an UpgradeCode property and an Upgrade table. Each record in the Upgrade table gives a characteristic combination of upgrade code, product version, and language information used to identify a set of products affected by the upgrade.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDatabaseTable.Verb
member.summary: The Verb table contains command-verb information associated with file extensions that must be generated as a part of product advertisement. Each row generates a set of registry keys and values.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: T:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty
member.summary: Internal class containing constants for MSI installer properties. This class cannot be inherited. This class cannot be instantiated directly.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.OriginalDatabase
member.summary: The installer sets the OriginalDatabase property to the launched-from database, the database on the source, or the cached database.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.SourceDir
member.summary: Root directory containing the source files.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.TARGETDIR
member.summary: Specifies the root destination directory for the installation. During an administrative installation this property is the location to copy the installation package.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ACTION
member.summary: Initial action called after the installer is initialized.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ALLUSERS
member.summary: Determines where configuration information will be stored.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPAUTHORIZEDCDFPREFIX
member.summary: URL of the update channel for the application.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPCOMMENTS
member.summary: Provides Comments for the Add or Remove Programs on Control Panel.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPCONTACT
member.summary: Provides Contact for the Add or Remove Programs on Control Panel.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPINSTALLLOCATION
member.summary: Fully qualified path to the application's primary folder.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPNOMODIFY
member.summary: Disables functionality that would modify the product.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPNOREMOVE
member.summary: Disables functionality that would remove the product.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPNOREPAIR
member.summary: Disables the Repair button in the Programs wizard.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPPRODUCTICON
member.summary: Specifies the primary icon for the installation package.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPREADME
member.summary: Provides a ReadMe for the Add or Remove Programs on Control Panel.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPSIZE
member.summary: Estimated size of the application in kilobytes.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPSYSTEMCOMPONENT
member.summary: Prevents display of application in the Add or Remove Programs list.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPURLINFOABOUT
member.summary: URL for an application's home page.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.AVAILABLEFREEREG
member.summary: Registry space in xilobytes required by the application. Used by AllocateRegistrySpace action.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.CCP_DRIVE
member.summary: The root path for any of the qualifying products for CCP.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.DefaultUIFont
member.summary: Default font style used for controls.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.DISABLEADVTSHORTCUTS
member.summary: Set to disable the generation certain shortcuts supporting installation-on-demand.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.DISABLEMEDIA
member.summary: Prevents the installer from registering media sources, such as a CD-ROMs, as valid sources for the product.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.DISABLEROLLBACK
member.summary: Disables rollback for the current configuration.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.EXECUTEACTION
member.summary: Top-level action initiated by the ExecuteAction action.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.EXECUTEMODE
member.summary: Mode of execution performed by the installer. (None, Script [default])

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.FASTOEM
member.summary: Improves installation performance under specific OEM scenarios.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.INSTALLLEVEL
member.summary: Initial "level" at which features will be installed. (1 - 32767)

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.LOGACTION
member.summary: List of action names that will be logged (separated only by semicolons and with no spaces.)

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MEDIAPACKAGEPATH
member.summary: This property must be set to the relative path if the installation package is not located at the root of the CD-ROM.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MSINODISABLEMEDIA
member.summary: Set to prevent the installer from setting the DISABLEMEDIA property. Available with Windows Installer version 1.0.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PRIMARYFOLDER
member.summary: Allows the author to designate a "primary" folder for the installation. Used to determine the values for the PrimaryVolumePath, PrimaryVolumeSpaceAvailable, PrimaryVolumeSpaceRequired, and PrimaryVolumeSpaceRemaining properties.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.Privileged
member.summary: Runs an installation with elevated privileges.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PROMPTROLLBACKCOST
member.summary: Action if there is insufficient disk space for the installation. (P - prompt, D - disable, F - fail)

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.REBOOT
member.summary: Forces or suppresses restarting. (Force, Suppress, ReallySuppress)

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.REBOOTPROMPT
member.summary: Suppresses the display of prompts for restarts to the user. Any restarts that are needed happen automatically. (S or Suppress)

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ROOTDRIVE
member.summary: Default drive for the installation. (Must end in '\')

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.SEQUENCE
member.summary: A table having the sequence table schema.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.SHORTFILENAMES
member.summary: Causes short file names to be used.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.Transforms
member.summary: List of transforms to be applied to the database.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.TRANSFORMSATSOURCE
member.summary: Informs the installer that the transforms for the product reside at the source.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.TRANSFORMSSECURE
member.summary: Setting the TRANSFORMSECURE property to 1 informs the installer that transforms are to be cached locally on the user's computer in a location where the user does not have write access.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ADDDEFAULT
member.summary: List of features (delimited by commas) to be installed in their default configuration.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ADDLOCAL
member.summary: List of features (delimited by commas) to be installed locally.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ADDSOURCE
member.summary: List of features (delimited by commas) to be run from source.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ADVERTISE
member.summary: List of features (delimited by commas) to be advertised.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.COMPADDLOCAL
member.summary: List of component IDs (delimited by commas) to be installed locally.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.COMPADDSOURCE
member.summary: List of component IDs (delimited by commas) to run from source media.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.FILEADDDEFAULT
member.summary: List of file keys of files (delimited by commas) that are to be installed in their default configuration.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.FILEADDLOCAL
member.summary: List of file keys of the files (delimited by commas) to be run locally.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.FILEADDSOURCE
member.summary: List of file keys (delimited by commas)to be run from the source media.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PATCH
member.summary: Setting this property applies a patch.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.REINSTALL
member.summary: List of features (delimited by commas) to be reinstalled.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.REINSTALLMODE
member.summary: A string containing letters that specify the type of reinstall to perform.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.REMOVE
member.summary: List of features (delimited by commas) to be removed.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.Alpha
member.summary: Numeric processor level if running on an Alpha processor.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.BorderSide
member.summary: The width, in pixels, of the window borders.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.BorderTop
member.summary: The height, in pixels, of the window borders.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Height, in pixels, of normal caption area.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ColorBits
member.summary: Number of adjacent color bits for each pixel.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.Intel
member.summary: Numeric processor level if running on an Intel processor.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.Intel64
member.summary: Numeric processor level if running on an Itanium processor.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PhysicalMemory
member.summary: Size of the installed RAM in megabytes.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ScreenX
member.summary: Width, in pixels, of the screen.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ScreenY
member.summary: Height, in pixels, of the screen.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.TextHeight
member.summary: The height of characters in logical units.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.VirtualMemory
member.summary: Amount of available page file space in megabytes.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.AFTERREBOOT
member.summary: Indicates current installation follows a reboot invoked by the ForceReboot action.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.CostingComplete
member.summary: Indicates whether disk space costing has completed.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.Installed
member.summary: Indicates that a product is already installed.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MSICHECKCRCS
member.summary: The installer does a CRC on files only if the MSICHECKCRCS property is set.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.NOCOMPANYNAME
member.summary: Suppresses the automatic setting of the COMPANYNAME property.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.NOUSERNAME
member.summary: Suppresses the automatic setting of the USERNAME property.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.OutOfDiskSpace
member.summary: Insufficient disk space to accommodate the installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.OutOfNoRbDiskSpace
member.summary: Insufficient disk space with rollback turned off.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PrimaryVolumePath
member.summary: The Installer sets the value of this property to the path of the volume designated by the PRIMARYFOLDER property.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PrimaryVolumeSpaceAvailable
member.summary: The Installer sets the value of this property to a string representing the total number of bytes available on the volume referenced by the PrimaryVolumePath property.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PrimaryVolumeSpaceRemaining
member.summary: The Installer sets the value of this property to a string representing the total number of bytes remaining on the volume referenced by the PrimaryVolumePath property if all the currently selected features were installed.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PrimaryVolumeSpaceRequired
member.summary: The Installer sets the value of this property to a string representing the total number of bytes required by all currently selected features on the volume referenced by the PrimaryVolumePath property.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ProductLanguage
member.summary: Numeric language identifier (LANGID) for the database. (REQUIRED)

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ReplacedInUseFiles
member.summary: Set if the installer installs over a file that is being held in use.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.RollbackDisabled
member.summary: The installer sets this property whenever rollback is disabled.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.UpdateStarted
member.summary: Set when changes to the system have begun for this installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.UPGRADINGPRODUCTCODE
member.summary: Set by the installer when an upgrade removes an application. Available with Windows Installer version 1.1 or later.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.VersionMsi
member.summary: The installer sets this property to the version of Windows Installer run during the installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.AdminUser
member.summary: Set on Microsoft Windows NT/Windows 2000 if the user has administrator privileges.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ComputerName
member.summary: Computer name of the current system.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MsiNTProductType
member.summary: Indicates the Windows product type. Only available with Windows Installer version 2.0 and later versions.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MsiNTSuiteBackOffice
member.summary: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the installer sets this property to 1 only if Microsoft BackOffice components are installed. Only available with Windows Installer version 2.0 and later versions.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MsiNTSuiteDataCenter
member.summary: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the installer sets this property to 1 only if Windows 2000 DataCenter Server is installed. Only available with Windows Installer version 2.0 and later versions.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MsiNTSuiteEnterprise
member.summary: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the installer sets this property to 1 only if Windows 2000 Advanced Server is installed. Only available with Windows Installer version 2.0 and later versions.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MsiNTSuiteSmallBusiness
member.summary: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the installer sets this property to 1 only if Microsoft Small Business Server is installed. Only available with Windows Installer version 2.0 and later versions.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MsiNTSuiteSmallBusinessRestricted
member.summary: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the installer sets this property to 1 only if Microsoft Small Business Server is installed with the restrictive client license. Only available with Windows Installer version 2.0 and later.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MsiNTSuiteWebServer
member.summary: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the installer sets the MsiNTSuiteWebServer property to 1 if the web edition of the Windows 2003 Server family is installed. Only available with the Windows Server 2003 family release of the Windows Installer.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MsiNTSuitePersonal
member.summary: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the installer sets this property to 1 only if the operating system is Workstation Personal (not Professional). Only available with Windows Installer version 2.0 and later versions.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MsiNetAssemblySupport
member.summary: On systems that support common language runtime assemblies, the installer sets the value of this property to the file version of fusion.dll. The installer does not set this property if the operating system does not support common language runtime assemblies. Only available with Windows Installer version 2.0 and later.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MsiWin32AssemblySupport
member.summary: On systems that support Win32 assemblies, the installer sets the value of this property to the file version of sxs.dll. The installer does not set this property if the operating system does not support Win32 assemblies. Only available with Windows Installer version 2.0 and later.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.OLEAdvtSupport
member.summary: Set if OLE supports the Windows Installer.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.RedirectedDLLSupport
member.summary: The installer sets the RedirectedDLLSupport property if the system performing the installation supports Isolated Components.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.RemoteAdminTS
member.summary: The installer sets the RemoteAdminTS property when the system is a remote administration server using Terminal Services.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ServicePackLevel
member.summary: The version number of the operating system service pack.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ServicePackLevelMinor
member.summary: The minor version number of the operating system service pack.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.SharedWindows
member.summary: Set when the system is operating as Shared Windows.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ShellAdvtSupport
member.summary: Set if the shell supports feature advertising.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.SystemLanguageID
member.summary: Default language identifier for the system.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.TerminalServer
member.summary: Set when the system is a server with Windows Terminal Server.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.TTCSupport
member.summary: Indicates if the operating system supports using .TTC (true type font collections) files.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.Version9X
member.summary: Version number for the Windows operating system.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.VersionDatabase
member.summary: Numeric database version of the current installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.VersionNT
member.summary: Version number for the Windows NT/Windows 2000 operating system.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.VersionNT64
member.summary: Version number for the Windows NT/Windows 2000 operating system if the system is running on a 64-bit computer.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.WindowsBuild
member.summary: Build number of the operating system.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ARPHELPLINK
member.summary: Internet address, or URL, for technical support.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.DiskPrompt
member.summary: String displayed by a message box prompting for a disk.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.IsAdminPackage
member.summary: Set to 1 if the current installation is running from a package created through an administrative installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.LeftUnit
member.summary: Places units to the left of the number.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MediaSourceDir
member.summary: The installer sets this property to 1 when the installation uses a media source, such as a CD-ROM.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MSIINSTANCEGUID
member.summary: The presence of this property indicates that a product code changing transform is registered to the product.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.MSINEWINSTANCE
member.summary: This property indicates the installation of a new instance of a product with instance transforms.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PIDTemplate
member.summary: String used as a template for the PIDKEY property.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ProductCode
member.summary: A unique identifier for the particular product release. (Required.)

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ProductState
member.summary: Set to the installed state of a product. (-1 unknown, 1 advertised, 2 absent, 5 default)

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.ProductVersion
member.summary: String format of the product version as a numeric value. (Required.)

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.UpgradeCode
member.summary: A GUID representing a related set of products.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PATCHNEWPACKAGECODE
member.summary: The value of this property is written to the Revision Number Summary Property.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PATCHNEWSUMMARYCOMMENTS
member.summary: The value of this property is written to the Comments Summary Property.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.PATCHNEWSUMMARYSUBJECT
member.summary: The value of this property is written to the Subject Summary Property.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.AdminToolsFolder
member.summary: Full path to the directory containing administrative tools for an individual user.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.AppDataFolder
member.summary: Full path to the Application Data folder for the current user.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallerProperty.CommonAppDataFolder

member.name: T:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN Windows Installer documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.Visible
member.summary: If the Visible Control bit is set, the control is visible on the dialog box. If this bit is not set, the control is hidden on the dialog box. The visible or hidden state of the Visible control attribute can be later changed by a Control Event.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.Enabled
member.summary: This attribute specifies if the given control is enabled or disabled. Most controls appear gray when disabled.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.Sunken
member.summary: If this bit is set, the control is displayed with a sunken, three dimensional look. The effect of this style bit is different on different controls and versions of Windows. On some controls it has no visible effect. If the system does not support the Sunken control attribute, the control is displayed in the default visual style. If this bit is not set, the control is displayed with the default visual style.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.Indirect
member.summary: The Indirect control attribute specifies whether the value displayed or changed by this control is referenced indirectly. If this bit is set, the control displays or changes the value of the property that has the identifier listed in the Property column of the Control table. If this bit is not set, the control displays or changes the value of the property in the Property column of the Control table.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.Integer
member.summary: If this bit is set on a control, the associated property specified in the Property column of the Control table is an integer. If this bit is not set, the property is a string value.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.RTLRO
member.summary: If this style bit is set the text in the control is displayed in a right-to-left reading order.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.RightAligned
member.summary: If this style bit is set, text in the control is aligned to the right.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.LeftScroll
member.summary: If this bit is set, the scroll bar is located on the left side of the control. If this bit is not set, the scroll bar is on the right side of the control.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.BiDi
member.summary: This is a combination of the right-to-left reading order , the , and attributes.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.Transparent
member.summary: If the Transparent Control bit is set on a text control, the control is displayed transparently with the background showing through the control where there are no characters. If this bit is not set the text control is opaque.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.NoPrefix
member.summary: If this bit is set on a text control, the occurrence of the ampersand character in a text string is displayed as itself. If this bit is not set, then the character following the ampersand in the text string is displayed as an underscored character.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.NoWrap
member.summary: If this bit is set the text in the control is displayed on a single line. If the text extends beyond the control's margins it is truncated and an ellipsis ("...") is inserted at the end to indicate the truncation. If this bit is not set, text wraps.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.FormatSize
member.summary: If this bit is set for a static text control, the control will automatically attempt to format the displayed text as a number representing a count of bytes. For proper formatting, the control's text must be set to a string representing a number expressed in units of 512 bytes. The displayed value will then be formatted in terms of kilobytes (KB), megabytes (MB), or gigabytes (GB), and displayed with the appropriate string representing the units. Kb = Less than 20480. Mb = Less than 20971520. Gb = Less than 10737418240

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.UsersLanguage
member.summary: If this bit flag is set, fonts are created using the user's default UI code page. If the bit flag is not set, fonts are created using the database code page.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.MultiLine
member.summary: If this bit is set on an Edit control, the installer creates a multiple line edit control with a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.Progress95
member.summary: If this bit is set on a ProgressBar control, the bar is drawn as a series of small rectangles in Microsoft Windows 95-style. If this bit is not set, the progress indicator bar is drawn as a single continuous rectangle.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.RemovableVolume
member.summary: If this bit is set, the control shows all the volumes involved in the current installation plus all the removable volumes. If this bit is not set, the control lists volumes in the current installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.FixedVolume
member.summary: If the FixedVolume Control bit is set, the control shows all the volumes involved in the current installation plus all the fixed internal hard drives. If this bit is not set, the control lists the volumes in the current installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.RemoteVolume
member.summary: If this bit is set, the control shows all the volumes involved in the current installation plus all the remote volumes. If this bit is not set, the control lists volumes in the current installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.CDRomVolume
member.summary: If the CDROMVolume Control bit is set, the control shows all the volumes in the current installation plus all the CD-ROM volumes. If this bit is not set, the control shows all the volumes in the current installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.RAMDiskVolume
member.summary: If this bit is set, the control shows all the volumes involved in the current installation plus all the RAM disk volumes. If this bit is not set the control lists volumes in the current installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.FloppyVolume
member.summary: If the FloppyVolume Control bit is set, the control shows all the volumes involved in the current installation plus all the floppy volumes. If this bit is not set, the control lists volumes in the current installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.Sorted
member.summary: If this bit is set, the items listed in the control are displayed in a specified order. If the bit is not set, items are displayed in alphabetical order.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.ComboList
member.summary: If the ComboList Control bit is set on a combo box, the edit field is replaced by a static text field. This prevents a user from entering a new value and requires the user to choose only one of the predefined values. If this bit is not set, the combo box has an edit field.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.PushLike
member.summary: If this bit is set on a check box or a radio button group, the button is drawn with the appearance of a push button, but its logic stays the same. If the bit is not set, the controls are drawn in their usual style.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.Bitmap
member.summary: If the Bitmap Control bit is set, the text in the control is replaced by a bitmap image. The Text column in the Control table is a foreign key into the Binary table. If this bit is not set, the text in the control is specified in the Text column of the Control table.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.Icon
member.summary: If this bit is set, text is replaced by an icon image and the Text column in the Control table is a foreign key into the Binary table. If this bit is not set, text in the control is specified in the Text column of the Control table.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.FixedSize
member.summary: If the FixedSize Control bit is set, the picture is cropped or centered in the control without changing its shape or size. If this bit is not set the picture is stretched to fit the control.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiControlAttribute.HasBorder
member.summary: If this bit is set, the RadioButtonGroup has text and a border displayed around it. If the style bit is not set, the border is not displayed and no text is displayed on the group.

member.name: T:WindowsInstaller.MsiCostTree

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiCostTree.Parents
member.summary: The parent features of the indicated feature are included in the cost.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiCustomActionType.FirstSequence

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiCustomActionType.OncePerProcess

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiCustomActionType.ClientRepeat

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiCustomActionType.Rollback
member.summary: in conjunction with InScript: queue in Rollback script

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiCustomActionType.Commit
member.summary: in conjunction with InScript: run Commit ops from script on success

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiCustomActionType.NoImpersonate
member.summary: no impersonation, run in system context

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiCustomActionType.TSAware
member.summary: impersonate for per-machine installs on TS machines

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiCustomActionType.HideTarget
member.summary: don't record the contents of the Target field in the log file.

member.summary: new record duplicates primary keys of existing record in table

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDbError.Required
member.summary: non-nullable column, no null values allowed

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDbError.BadLink

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDbError.BadCustomSource

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDbError.BadCategory

member.name: T:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN Windows Installer documentation for more information.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.Visible
member.summary: If this bit is set the dialog is originally created as visible, otherwise it is hidden.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.Modal
member.summary: If this bit is set, the dialog box is modal, other dialogs of the same application cannot be put on top of it, and the dialog keeps the control while it is running. If this bit is not set, the dialog is modeless, other dialogs of the same application may be moved on top of it. After a modeless dialog is created and displayed, the user interface returns control to the installer. The installer then calls the user interface periodically to update the dialog and to give it a chance to process the messages. As soon as this is done, the control is returned to the installer. Note There should be no modeless dialogs in a wizard sequence, since this would return control to the installer, ending the wizard sequence prematurely.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.Minimize
member.summary: If this bit is set, the dialog box can be minimized. This bit is ignored for modal dialog boxes, which cannot be minimized.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.SysModal
member.summary: If this style bit is set, the dialog box will stop all other applications and no other applications can take the focus. This state remains until the SysModal dialog is dismissed.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.KeepModeless
member.summary: Normally, when this bit is not set and a dialog box is created through DoAction, all other (typically modeless) dialogs are destroyed. If this bit is set, the other dialogs stay alive when this dialog box is created.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.TrackDiskSpace
member.summary: If this bit is set, the dialog box periodically calls the installer. If the property changes, it notifies the controls on the dialog. This style can be used if there is a control on the dialog indicating disk space. If the user switches to another application, adds or removes files, or otherwise modifies available disk space, you can quickly implement the change using this style. Any dialog box relying on the OutOfDiskSpace property to determine whether to bring up a dialog must set the TrackDiskSpace Dialog Style Bit for the dialog to dynamically update space on the target volumes.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.UseCustomPalette
member.summary: If this bit is set, the pictures on the dialog box are created with the custom palette (one per dialog received from the first control created). If the bit is not set, the pictures are rendered using a default palette.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.RTLRO
member.summary: If this style bit is set the text in the dialog box is displayed in right-to-left-reading order.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.RightAligned
member.summary: If this style bit is set, the text is aligned on the right side of the dialog box.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.LeftScroll
member.summary: If this style bit is set, the scroll bar is located on the left side of the dialog box.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.BiDi
member.summary: This is a combination of the right to left reading order , the , and the dialog style bits.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiDialogStyle.Error
member.summary: If this bit is set, the dialog box is an error dialog.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.FileNotFound

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.OutOfMemory

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.OpenFailed

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.DiskFull

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.CallNotImplemented

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.FileInvalid

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.AppHelpBlock
member.summary: This error code only occurs when using Windows Installer version 2.0 and Windows XP. If Windows Installer determines a product may be incompatible with the current operating system, it displays a dialog box informing the user and asking whether to try to install anyway. This error code is returned if the user chooses not to try the installation.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.InstallServiceFailure
member.summary: The Windows Installer service could not be accessed.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.InstallFailure

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.UnknownProduct

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.UnknownFeature
member.summary: The feature identifier is not registered.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.UnknownComponent
member.summary: The component identifier is not registered.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.InvalidHandleState
member.summary: The handle is in an invalid state.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.BadConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration data for this product is corrupt.

member.summary: The installation source for this product is not available. Verify that the source exists and that you can access it.

member.name: F:WindowsInstaller.MsiError.PatchTargetNotFound
member.summary: The installer cannot install the upgrade patch because the program being upgraded may be missing or the upgrade patch updates a different version of the program. Verify that the program to be upgraded exists on your computer and that you have the correct upgrade patch. This error code is not available on Windows Installer version 1.0.

member.name: M:WindowsInstaller.MsiInterop.MsiAdvertiseProduct(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt16)
member.summary: The MsiAdvertiseProduct function generates an advertise script or advertises a product to the computer. The MsiAdvertiseProduct function enables the installer to write to a script the registry and shortcut information used to assign or publish a product. The script can be written to be consistent with a specified platform by using .
member.param: The full path to the package of the product being advertised.
The full path to script file that will be created with the advertise information. To advertise the product locally to the computer, set or .

A semicolon-delimited list of transforms to be applied. The list of transforms can be prefixed with the @ or | character to specify the secure caching of transforms. The @ prefix specifies secure-at-source transforms and the | prefix indicates secure full path transforms. This parameter may be null.
The installation language to use if the source supports multiple languages.

returns.para: The function succeeded.
This error is returned if an attempt is made to generate an advertise script on any platform other than Windows 2000 or Windows XP. Advertisement to the local computer is supported on all platforms.
An error relating to an action, see .

member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: M:WindowsInstaller.MsiInterop.MsiAdvertiseProductEx(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt16,WindowsInstaller.PlatformArchitecture,WindowsInstaller.MsiAdvertismentOptions)
member.summary: The MsiAdvertiseProductEx function generates an advertise script or advertises a product to the computer. The MsiAdvertiseProductEx function enables the installer to write to a script the registry and shortcut information used to assign or publish a product. Provides the same functionality as . The script can be written to be consistent with a specified platform by using MsiAdvertiseProductEx.
member.param: The full path to the package of the product being advertised.
The full path to script file that will be created with the advertise information. To advertise the product locally to the computer, set or .

A semicolon-delimited list of transforms to be applied. The list of transforms can be prefixed with the @ or | character to specify the secure caching of transforms. The @ prefix specifies secure-at-source transforms and the | prefix indicates secure full path transforms. This parameter may be null.
The installation language to use if the source supports multiple languages.

Bit flags that control for which platform the installer should create the script. This parameter is ignored if script is null. If platform is , then the script is created based on the current platform. This is the same functionality as . If platform is or , the installer creates script for the specified platform.

Bit flags that specify extra advertisement options. Nonzero value is only available in Windows Installer versions shipped with Windows Server 2003 family and later and Windows XP Service Pack 1 and later.

returns.para: The function succeeded.
This error is returned if an attempt is made to generate an advertise script on any platform other than Windows 2000 or Windows XP. Advertisement to the local computer is supported on all platforms.
An error relating to an action, see .

member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: M:WindowsInstaller.MsiInterop.MsiApplyPatch(System.String,System.String,WindowsInstaller.MsiInstallType,System.String)
member.summary: For each product listed by the patch package as eligible to receive the patch, the MsiApplyPatch function invokes an installation and sets the PATCH property to the path of the patch package.
member.param: A null-terminated string specifying the full path to the patch package.

param.name: installPackage
param.para: If installtype is set to , this parameter is a null-terminated string that specifies a path to the product that is to be patched. The installer applies the patch to every eligible product listed in the patch package if installPackage is set to null and installType is set to .

If installtype is , the installer applies the patch to the product specified by installPackage. In this case, other eligible products listed in the patch package are ignored and the installPackage parameter contains the null-terminated string representing the product code of the instance to patch. This type of installation requires the installer running Windows .NET Server 2003 family or Windows XP SP1.

param.name: installType
param.para: This parameter specifies the type of installation to patch.
Specifies an administrative installation. In this case, installPackage must be set to a package path. A value of 1 for sets this for an administrative installation.
Searches system for products to patch. In this case, szInstallPackage must be null.

Patch the product specified by szInstallPackage. installPackage is the product code of the instance to patch. This type of installation requires the installer running Windows .NET Server 2003 family or Windows XP SP1.

member.param: A null-terminated string that specifies command line property settings.

returns.para: The function succeeded.
Patch package could not be opened.
The patch package is invalid.
The patch package is not unsupported.
An error relating to an action, see .

member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

member.name: M:WindowsInstaller.MsiInterop.MsiCloseAllHandles
member.summary: The MsiCloseAllHandles function closes all open installation handles allocated by the current thread. This is a diagnostic function and should not be used for cleanup.
member.returns: This function returns 0 if all handles are closed. Otherwise, the function returns the number of handles open prior to its call.
member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.

returns.para: The function succeeded.

member.remarks: Please refer to the MSDN documentation for more information.
